long: Meaning: "evil" (as "destructive"), literally ("ruin") or morally (especially "guile"); figuratively "idolatry" (as false, subjective), "uselessness" (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in "vain").  Usage: false(-ly), lie, lying, vain, vanity.  Source: or "שַׁו"; from the same as "H7722" in the sense of "desolating";
